holidays.name: National Eggnog Day
holidays.description: A festive celebration of the creamy, spiced holiday staple known as eggnog. Perfect for indulging in this rich, sweet drink often topped with a sprinkle of nutmeg.
holidays.origin: This unofficial food holiday has grown popular in the United States as part of the Christmas season traditions, dating back to colonial times when eggnog originated.
holidays.funFact: Eggnog was originally made with expensive ingredients like rum, eggs, and milk, making it a luxurious holiday treat in early America.

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: The evening or entire day before Christmas Day, often celebrated with family gatherings, festive dinners, and gift exchanges around the world.
holidays.origin: Rooted in Christian tradition as the vigil before the birth of Jesus, Christmas Eve has evolved with various cultural customs across different countries.
holidays.funFact: In many countries, like Poland and Sweden, Christmas Eve is the main event for gift-giving rather than Christmas Day itself.

holidays.name: Friendly Sons of St. Patrick Society Day
holidays.description: A quirky, lesser-known observance by a Philadelphia-based group celebrating Irish heritage and community service just before Christmas.
holidays.origin: Founded in the 18th century, this society organizes festive events and charitable activities, and December 24 marks their traditional gathering date.
holidays.funFact: The Friendly Sons of St. Patrick helped establish early Irish-American social and cultural traditions long before St. Patrick's Day became widely celebrated.
